speaker: Counter
lines: The counter is scarred in careful places; stories end where dents begin.
A slate lists iron by the pound and promises by the look.
A bell sits on the edge; it rings if you touch it and if you don't.
A ledger is open to a page where no debts have been written yet.
The smith taps a quill like a man timing a song he wants to start right.
'Artifact business is dangerous business,' he says without punctuation.
'Wheel braces, hinges, nailsâ€”you can live long on nails.'
He studies your hands, decides which work fits.

choices.text: Take a commission from the board.
